channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump set to rally at Madison Square Garden in New York days before election
item.description: Former President Trump says 'we are going to win New York' despite double-digit losses in previous elections.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Trump says 'we are going to win New York' despite double-digit losses in previous elections.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Georgia's crucial vote was marred by intimidation, European monitors say
item.description: European observers said Sunday that Georgia's parliamentary election took place in a "climate of hatred and intimidation” with multiple violations and cases of violence.
item.content:encoded:
European observers said Sunday that Georgia's parliamentary election took place in a "climate of hatred and intimidation” with multiple violations and cases of violence.

(Image credit: Shakh Aivazov)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Dodgers beat Yankees 4-2 for 2-0 World Series lead, as Ohtani injures shoulder
item.description: Yamamoto allowed one hit over 6 1/3 innings, Freddie Freeman homered for the second straight night and Los Angeles beat the New York Yankees 4-2 on Saturday for a 2-0 Series lead.
item.content:encoded:
Yamamoto allowed one hit over 6 1/3 innings, Freddie Freeman homered for the second straight night and Los Angeles beat the New York Yankees 4-2 on Saturday for a 2-0 Series lead.

(Image credit: Ashley Landis/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Ever felt so stressed you didn’t know what to do next? Try talking to your 'parts'
item.description: 'Parts work' or Internal Family Systems is a type of talk therapy that’s surged in popularity. Here’s how it works and how it can help with stress.
item.content:encoded: 'Parts work' or Internal Family Systems is a type of talk therapy that’s surged in popularity. Here’s how it works and how it can help with stress.
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: Candy or potatoes? NPR readers share their quirky Halloween traditions
item.description: NPR asked readers for insights into their Halloween traditions and they did not disappoint. From unique offerings for trick-or-treaters to honoring loved ones, the activities are nowhere near sparse.
item.content:encoded: NPR asked readers for insights into their Halloween traditions and they did not disappoint. From unique offerings for trick-or-treaters to honoring loved ones, the activities are nowhere near sparse.
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Harris is reaching out to Republicans. Some progressives feel left behind
item.description: Vice President Harris has been campaigning with Republicans disaffected with former President Donald Trump. But some progressive voters aren’t loving the strategy.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris has been campaigning with Republicans disaffected with former President Donald Trump. But some progressive voters aren’t loving the strategy.

(Image credit: Asma Khalid)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: 'Things ran hot at SNL': Seth Meyers gets real on Wild Card this week
item.description: Seth Meyers opens up about his time on Saturday Night Live, his relationship with his parents, and how ambition led him away from his strengths.
item.content:encoded:
Seth Meyers opens up about his time on Saturday Night Live, his relationship with his parents, and how ambition led him away from his strengths.

(Image credit: Mike Coppola)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: Sikh separatist, targeted once for assassination, says India still trying to kill him
item.description: The alleged assassination attempt of a Sikh activist in the U.S. is part of a broader trend around the world in which foreign governments seek to silence critics overseas.
item.content:encoded:
The alleged assassination attempt of a Sikh activist in the U.S. is part of a broader trend around the world in which foreign governments seek to silence critics overseas.

(Image credit: Jeenah Moon for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Here's one of the only places you can ride in a Filipino jeepney
item.description: The popular, brightly painted minibuses are being phased out in the Philippines, but you can still tour San Francisco's Filipino Cultural District in one.
item.content:encoded:
The popular, brightly painted minibuses are being phased out in the Philippines, but you can still tour San Francisco's Filipino Cultural District in one.

(Image credit: Chloe Veltman)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: The GOP’s ‘survival instinct’ acts as an ally for Trump on Election Day and beyond
item.description: Former President Donald Trump needs voters who may have misgivings about him or some of his behavior but who have deep loyalty to the Republican Party or deep aversion to the Democrats.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Donald Trump needs voters who may have misgivings about him or some of his behavior but who have deep loyalty to the Republican Party or deep aversion to the Democrats.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Ron Elving
